docs.abstract: The wall is the biggest sticking point between the president and Democrats. President Trump wants funding for it in spending bills that must pass to avert a government shutdown.
docs.snippet: The wall is the biggest sticking point between the president and Democrats. President Trump wants funding for it in spending bills that must pass to avert a government shutdown.
docs.lead_paragraph: Both before and after a meeting on Tuesday with Representative Nancy Pelosi and Senator Chuck Schumer, the Democratic leaders in Congress, President Trump pushed a false narrative about the progress of a new wall along the country’s southwest border.

headline.main: Trump Makes Misleading Border Wall Claims Before and After Meeting With Democrats
headline.print_headline: Claims by Trump That Cross Boundaries

byline.original: By Eileen Sullivan and Linda Qiu

docs.abstract: The Times won for coverage of the Trump family’s finances and social media companies’ privacy practices. And for the first time in its 70-year history, the program gave an award to a podcast.
docs.snippet: The Times won for coverage of the Trump family’s finances and social media companies’ privacy practices. And for the first time in its 70-year history, the program gave an award to a podcast.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The New York Times on Tuesday won two George Polk awards for reporting on the Trump family’s use of dubious tax schemes and the trend of social media giants choosing profit over users’ privacy.

headline.main: New York Times Wins Two George Polk Awards
headline.print_headline: New York Times Wins  Two George Polk Awards

docs.abstract: The president blamed what he called the Democrats’ “intransigence” over border wall funding for his decision to skip the annual economic conference of elites in Switzerland.
docs.snippet: The president blamed what he called the Democrats’ “intransigence” over border wall funding for his decision to skip the annual economic conference of elites in Switzerland.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Thursday canceled his planned trip to the annual and glittering economic conference in Davos, Switzerland, citing what he called the Democrats’ intransigence on his funding request to build a wall along the United States’ southern border.

headline.main: Trump Cancels Davos Trip, Citing Battle Over Border Security at Home
headline.print_headline: President Jettisons Plan To Attend Davos Forum

docs.abstract: The economic penalties by the Trump administration marked the most forceful American action against President Nicolás Maduro, whom the U.S. is trying to oust.
docs.snippet: The economic penalties by the Trump administration marked the most forceful American action against President Nicolás Maduro, whom the U.S. is trying to oust.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration imposed sanctions against Venezuela’s state-owned oil company on Monday, seeking to cripple the government of embattled President Nicolás Maduro by cutting off its main source of cash.

headline.main: U.S. Targets Venezuela With Tough Oil Sanctions During Crisis of Power
headline.print_headline: U.S. Pummels Reeling Venezuela With Sanctions

byline.original: By Edward Wong and Nicholas Casey

docs.abstract: The Infowars founder and Trump backer is as much marketer as ideological warrior, selling products to assuage the fears he is so expert at stoking.
docs.snippet: The Infowars founder and Trump backer is as much marketer as ideological warrior, selling products to assuage the fears he is so expert at stoking.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN — More than ever before in his two-decade career built on baseless conspiracy theories, angry nativist rants and end-of-days fearmongering, Alex Jones is being called to account.

headline.main: Conspiracy Theories Made Alex Jones Very Rich. They May Bring Him Down.
headline.print_headline: Reckoning Imperils Infowars Founder’s Soapbox, and His Empire

byline.original: By Elizabeth Williamson and Emily Steel

docs.abstract: Kirstjen Nielsen sidestepped whether she supported the tactic as a way to deter illegal immigration and cited a “humanitarian catastrophe” on the border.
docs.snippet: Kirstjen Nielsen sidestepped whether she supported the tactic as a way to deter illegal immigration and cited a “humanitarian catastrophe” on the border.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kirstjen Nielsen, the homeland security secretary, on Wednesday tersely defended a now-defunct Trump administration practice of separating migrant children from their families at the border, sidestepping whether she supported it as a way to deter illegal immigration.

headline.main: Homeland Security Chief Spars With Democrats Over Splitting Migrant Families
headline.print_headline: Homeland Chief Cites ‘Catastrophe’ in Clash Over Border Security

byline.original: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Michael D. Shear

docs.abstract: The move to punish Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador came after President Trump said there would be a “very good likelihood” that he would seal off the United States border with Mexico next week.
docs.snippet: The move to punish Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador came after President Trump said there would be a “very good likelihood” that he would seal off the United States border with Mexico next week.
docs.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump said on Friday that there would be a “very good likelihood” that he would seal off the United States border with Mexico next week, even as he moved to punish Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador for migrant caravans by cutting off all foreign aid to the countries.

headline.main: Trump Directs State Dept. to End Aid to 3 Central American Countries
headline.print_headline: President Renews Threat To Close Mexican Border

byline.original: By Katie Rogers, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Michael D. Shear

docs.abstract: The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, has referred back to prosecutors in Virginia a case that once ensnared President Trump’s former national security adviser.
docs.snippet: The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, has referred back to prosecutors in Virginia a case that once ensnared President Trump’s former national security adviser.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal prosecutors in Virginia are investigating a secret Turkish lobbying effort that once involved Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, even as Mr. Flynn’s role in the special counsel’s investigation winds down, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

headline.main: As Flynn Case Winds Down, Investigation of Turkish Lobbying Persists
headline.print_headline: Flynn Inquiry Is Winding Down, but Investigators Are Still Following One Thread

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Mark Mazzetti and Adam Goldman

docs.abstract: Mr. Stone, a longtime informal adviser to President Trump, appeared in court in Washington He has declared that he will be “completely vindicated.”
docs.snippet: Mr. Stone, a longtime informal adviser to President Trump, appeared in court in Washington He has declared that he will be “completely vindicated.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s longtime adviser Roger J. Stone Jr. pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to felony charges in the special counsel investigation during a brief federal court appearance in which the often flamboyant Mr. Stone appeared solemn and said little.

headline.main: Roger Stone Pleads Not Guilty to Charges in Mueller Investigation

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Mark Mazzetti and Adam Goldman

docs.abstract: Sophisticated surveillance, once the domain of world powers, is increasingly available on the private market. Smaller countries are seizing on the tools — sometimes for darker purposes.
docs.snippet: Sophisticated surveillance, once the domain of world powers, is increasingly available on the private market. Smaller countries are seizing on the tools — sometimes for darker purposes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The man in charge of Saudi Arabia’s ruthless campaign to stifle dissent went searching for ways to spy on people he saw as threats to the kingdom. He knew where to go: a secretive Israeli company offering technology developed by former intelligence operatives.

headline.main: A New Age of Warfare: How Internet Mercenaries Do Battle for Authoritarian Governments
headline.print_headline: In New Age of Digital Warfare,  Spies for Any Nation’s Budget

byline.original: By Mark Mazzetti, Adam Goldman, Ronen Bergman and Nicole Perlroth
